conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and geometry involved.
Objects are casting shadows due to light source positioned to the left.
Shadows (A, B, C, and D) are elongated to the right.
When light source moves to the right, direction of light rays changes.
Shadows are cast opposite the direction of the light source.
Shadows will shift to the left as light moves to the right.
If light source is directly overhead, shadows will become shorter.
If light is not directly overhead but to the right, shadows will be shorter but elongated toward the left.
Shape of shadows might change slightly depending on angle.
Shadows will become shorter and shift to the left.
Final Answer: Shadows will move to the left and become shorter as light source moves to the right above the objects.
